title: How does Tough Skin interact with armor?
body: Just wondering, does it apply before or after reductions?

replies.body: After.

So!!! So!!! THEORETICALLY!!
If you reduced an enemy's damage to 2 after armor reduction!!!
TOUGH Skin WOulD NEGATE ThE DAMAGE ENTIRELY AT THAT pOINT??? YES??

I must know for my Thresh God Battle I'm hosting next month
I'm going to get 10000 SOULS!
That's correct, you could in theory zero out fairly small amounts of damage with sufficiently large amounts of Armor plus Tough Skin.
https://media.giphy.com/media/caTuwqwMl7V4c/giphy.gif

But what would happen if someone had even 1 armor pen? No matter how much armor you would have, they would still deal at least 1 damage?
Or if tough skin negates that damage, then 3 armor pen.

Or alternately a Mumu with ~100 armour VS creeps.
I don't think it's possible to do 0 damage. It shouldn't be.

Mathematically, you cannot do 0 damage. Armor causes you to receive damage according to the multiplier 100/(100+armor). As you get more and more armor, you get more and more closer to 0, but never getting 0.

Of course, due to rounding, you will eventually be dealing 0 damage
